body: Hello guys, Some components can collect annual hourly data and display it in additional analysis. I find it very useful but what slows me down is lack of control for the parameters for the data. For example if I want to show temperature distribution on a wind rose with specific color scheme, low/high bounds and number of segments I have to crop wind speed diagram (left) out of the image because legend parameter that I set for the dry bulb temp (right) ruins parameters for the wind speed.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/QqEwKwheuH8kjcHlE0GpAMPXdX0heFwZjfj1j4lQzYoegsTtW3VoQMzTtIiVPwSZFOvTdfKhMLi6IbdWLjTSwFdGKdGMKJlP/Capture.PNG) This is how it looks like (but not working): Wind rose picks up legend par #1 only [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/QqEwKwheuH8ZAkzAc0WbGXJ95Exu5gn5U6Dr*h*EU5wIct*uJB2A36S4TWIEypY0yRia0wFBRvir6h6yAXi1EwOR2rZe5DNs/wish.PNG) If I'm missing something  and there is a way to control multiple legends please let me know, I will delete this post.
topic: WISH: make multiple Legend Par connections
